title: 104_s894
content: The "California Ocean Protection Act of 1995" aims to protect the unique values of the California coast from threats like fossil fuel exploration and toxic waste dumping. Establishing an ocean protection zone would enhance fisheries and renewable resource use. In this Act, key definitions include the Administrator as the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, development as defined in the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act, Exclusive Economic Zone as per Presidential Proclamation 5030, exploration as defined in the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act, and harmful ocean dumping determined by the Administrator in consultation with other Federal agencies. The Administrator determines appropriate federal agencies for disposal of vessel waste and dredged material meeting specific criteria under the Marine Protection Act. The term "minerals" is defined in the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act, while the term "outer continental shelf" is defined in the same act. Additionally, the Marine Protection Act authorizes appropriate federal agencies to carry out disposal of vessel waste and dredged material. The terms "shelf," "person," "production," "territorial sea," and "zone" are defined in the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act. The territorial sea is defined as the belt of sea measured from the baseline of the United States. The Zone refers to the California Ocean Protection Zone established under section 4. The California Ocean Protection Zone is established, including waters of the Exclusive Economic Zone, territorial sea, and outer Continental Shelf. Restrictions are also imposed. The California Ocean Protection Zone is established, including waters of the Exclusive Economic Zone, territorial sea, and outer Continental Shelf. Restrictions are imposed on mineral exploration, development, and production in the Zone, prohibiting the issuance of leases, permits, or licenses for oil, gas, or other minerals after the cancellation, expiration, relinquishment, or termination of existing agreements. The California Ocean Protection Zone prohibits the issuance of leases, permits, or licenses for ocean incineration or harmful ocean dumping within the Zone. SEC. 6. FISHING. The Act does not regulate or restrict commercial or recreational fishing in the Zone.
